column3: For students with no previous knowledge of Greek. Introduces basic grammar and vocabulary.
Completes the presentation of grammar and introduces reading of literature.

column2: Readings in the Greek New Testament and Septuagint
column3: Readings in ancient (koine) Greek from the New Testament and the Septuagint. Students aim to achieve fluency in reading and to enrich their knowledge of key terms and ideas borrowed from the Greek past in the early Christian tradition. Formerly CLAS 3013.
Reading of selected prose texts of authors in ancient Greek such as Plato, Xenophon, Lysias, and selections from the Greek New Testament. Incorporates review of grammar.
Reading of selections from Homer or a Greek tragedy in ancient Greek, with attention to literary form and context as well as advanced grammar and syntax.
